q: added that he's already talked to Andy Reid about what he needs to improve on this offseason. ''I think I've got the blueprint on what to do,'' Michael Vick said. I sat down and talked with Andy yesterday. He had a whole list of things that he thought I needed to do. It's good because without that I wouldn't see it or I wouldn't know, so that gives me guidance, areas to work on. Michael Vick admitted that he tried too often to make a big play last season. defence secretary was reluctant to endorse Bush's assessment that the decision to draw down US troops shortly after the 2003 invasion of Iraq was ''the most important failure in the execution of the war''. likely- if Eric Schmidt is not already tied down by a noncompete agreement. Could Eric Schmidt transition from his elder-statesman gig into a bigger role in politics? That's one theory of author Ken Auletta , author of Googled: The End of the World as We Know It. John C, Dvorak also thinks Eric Schmidt could end up in a role with the Obama administration, one that would be good for tech and policy. See Dvorak; s column on Eric Schmidt 's next act
